Description: Fragment of round handle at neck join probably from a Brindisi pottery transport amphora. Clay near fine light brown; some large, mixed inclusions. Rectangular stamp at top of handle with Latin inscription.
Curator's comments: Name Baton. cf. Desy, Ph., Les timbres amphoriques de l'Apulie republicaine (Oxford 1989) 172. Not from same die as 1955,0920.87. P.Palazzo, Le anfore di Apani (Rome, 2013) 97-8.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1347)
